sentences: Alicia Michelle "Miki" Howard (born September 30, 1960) is an American singer and actress who had a string of top 10 hit songs in the mid-1980s and early 1990s, including "Baby, Be Mine" (1987), "Come Share My Love" (1986) and "Love Under New Management" (1990).
section: N/A

sentences: "Ain't Nobody Like You" (1992) and "Ain't Nuthin' in the World" (1989) both peaked at number one on the U.S. Billboard Top R&B Singles chart.
section: N/A
== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Howard was born in Chicago, Illinois.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She is the daughter of gospel singers Josephine Howard (1937-1978) of The Caravans and Clay Graham (1936-2018) of The Pilgrim Jubilees.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Howard's mother took her to the homes of various stars such as Aretha Franklin and Mavis Staples.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: At the age of nine, Howard and her family moved to Los Angeles where Howard's mother sang in a choir led by Caravans member and arranger James Cleveland.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Among those who visited Howard's Los Angeles residence were Albertina Walker, Shirley Caesar, Billy Preston and Fats Domino.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Howard was also influenced by jazz greats, Billie Holiday, Dinah Washington and Nancy Wilson.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: As a teenager, she often visited Maverick's Flat, a popular night club in Los Angeles and a venue for music acts such as Rufus and Chaka Khan and Earth, Wind & Fire, who were influential in her pursuit of a professional singing career.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: At the age of 16, she performed in a teen pageant.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: After the show, she met singer Augie Johnson, leader and member of R&B group Side Effect, who happened to be in the audience and began working with Howard on music.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: Johnson charmed Howard and later chose her as the vocalist for the group.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: After a period of time, Howard became a Side Effect member in 1979—replacing the departure of Sylvia St. James.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: Howard's tenure with the group lasted a few years.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: With Miki as new female vocalist, Side Effect's After the Rain was released in 1980.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: The album did not do well on the charts as well as the next two Elektra albums Portraits and All Aboard.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: As a member of Side Effect, the group's best remembered "I Can't Play" and a cover of Toto's "Georgy Porgy" were minor R&B hits in 1983/84.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: During this time, she also had one child by Johnson.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: In addition to singing with Side Effect, she did background vocals for Wayne Henderson, Roy Ayers, Stanley Turrentine, and several other artists.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: By 1985, Howard decided she was ready to begin a solo career, and left the group.
section: == Music career == | === 1980–1985: Side Effect ===

sentences: She put together a demo that landed her a recording contract with Atlantic Records.

sentences: A second single and music video for "Release Me", was released, the song received modest radio airplay and peaked at number 43 on the R&B singles chart and also peaked at number 35 on the R&B/Hip-Hop Airplay charts.

sentences: 2014-present: I Choose to Be Happy and touring ===
section: == Music career == | === 2014-present: I Choose to Be Happy and touring ===

sentences: Howard will soon be releasing her brand new album, I Choose to Be Happy due out this summer.
section: == Music career == | === 2014-present: I Choose to Be Happy and touring ===

sentences: The original title, Something Old, Something New, Something Borrowed, Something Blues was "too long", but is how Miki describes this project.
section: == Music career == | === 2014-present: I Choose to Be Happy and touring ===

sentences: The album includes four new songs, also the new single "Panther" which features rapper Too Short and some of her greatest hits re-recorded live.
section: == Music career == | === 2014-present: I Choose to Be Happy and touring ===

sentences: "I Choose to Be Happy" will also include a new song, the title track, "I Choose to be Happy" and a tribute to Marvin Gaye titled "Soon I'll Be Loving You Again" which features son Brandon Howard and David Ruffin Jr. While recording her new album, Howard has been touring throughout the U.S. and overseas, performing the album's first single, "Panther" as well as her classic hit songs.
section: == Music career == | === 2014-present: I Choose to Be Happy and touring ===

sentences: On September 25, 2015, Howard released her second live album titled Miki Howard: Live in Concert.
section: == Music career == | === 2014-present: I Choose to Be Happy and touring ===

sentences: The release features her performance of hits throughout her music career, and cover versions of "My Man", "Pillow Talk", "This Bitter Earth", and Marvin Gaye's "Soon I'll Be Loving You Again".
